subject: Reimbursement of medical expenses in those cases where officer/ employee seeks permission to allow Husband and/or wife to avail benefit of medical facility from their respective organization-reg.

No. 145790)} Sub.  Reimbursement of medical expenses in those cases where officer/ employee seeks permission to allow Husband andlor wife to avail benefit of medical facility from their respective organizations -reg: In continuation with policy matter-Administration /Finance(82/2004) dated  23/04/2004 regarding simplification of procedures for settling claims of reimbursement of expenditure incurred on medical expenses, it has now also been decided that in those cases, where spouse of the officer Iemployee is in the service of the Government or an organization owned or controlled by the Government and officer /employee seeks permission to allow his/her Husband or wife to avail the benefit of medical facility from their respective organization, she/he may be permitted, subject to the following conditions: The officer /employee will have to give an undertaking; that a. His/her spouse will not draw any medical allowance (if admissible in his/her department) and instead will claim medical reimbursement as per actual expenditure in respect of his her declared eligible dependent(s) only. A certificate from the office of spouse to this effect should be submitted, and b_ The officer/ employee will claim medical reimbursement a5 per actual (on production of bills/cash memo) only for his/her declared eligible dependent(s) and will have to forego the fixed medical allowances of one month basic permissible under the NHAI regulation. 2 Further, a letter to the effect shall be submitted in the parent organization of the spouse about this arrangement, obtaining due acknowledgement of the controlling officer of the spouse_ 3 This would be effective from the date of issue of this policy circular. 4 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority- slz2z (Sanjay Kumar Patel) General Manager (Coord:) To: All Officers of NHAI HQ ROs/ PIUs/ CMUs/ Site Offices to: 13 Hindi Officer for translation in Hindi. 2 Library for hosting the circular on library site. 3 .
